snippet: As the State Department advised Americans to leave, Saleh Ali al-Sammad, a senior Houthi leader, said the group wanted to share power with its political rivals and maintain good relations with allies.
abstract: Saleh Ali al-Sammad, leader of Houthi militants who have taken over capital of Sana, Yemen, announces group's willingness to work with rivals and with ally nations during United Nations-mediated talks; statement points to softening of group's position following declaration of unilateral plan to form new government.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SHUAIB ALMOSAWA

lead_paragraph: As the State Department advised Americans to leave, Saleh Ali al-Sammad, a senior Houthi leader, said the group wanted to share power with its political rivals and maintain good relations with allies.

headline.main: U.S. Embassy Shuts in Yemen, Even as Militant Leader Reaches Out
headline.print_headline: Yemeni Militant Leader Pledges to Share Power
